Package Sqnnect

Class DBTablePrinter

java.lang.Object
Sqnnect.DBTablePrinter
public class DBTablePrinter extends Object
Just a utility to print rows from a given DB table or a ResultSet to standard out, formatted to look like a table with rows and columns with borders.

Stack Overflow website (stackoverflow.com) was the primary source of inspiration and help to put this code together. Especially the questions and answers of the following people were very useful:

Question: How to display or print the contents of a database table as is
People: sky scraper

Question: System.out.println() from database into a table
People: Simon Cottrill, Tony Toews, Costis Aivali, Riggy, corsiKa

Question: Simple way to repeat a string in java
People: Everybody who contributed but especially user102008

    Column type category for TINYINT, SMALLINT, INT and BIGINT columns.
    static final int
    CATEGORY_OTHER
    Column type category for types for which the type name will be printed instead of the content, like BLOB, BINARY, ARRAY etc.
    static final int

    Column type category for CHAR, VARCHAR and similar text columns.

  • Method Details

    • printTable

      public static void printTable(Connection conn, String tableName)
      Overloaded method that prints rows from table tableName to standard out using the given database connection conn. Total number of rows will be limited to DEFAULT_MAX_ROWS and DEFAULT_MAX_TEXT_COL_WIDTH will be used to limit the width of text columns (like a VARCHAR column).
      Parameters:
      conn - Database connection object (java.sql.Connection)
      tableName - Name of the database table

    • printTable

      public static void printTable(Connection conn, String tableName, int maxRows)
      Overloaded method that prints rows from table tableName to standard out using the given database connection conn. Total number of rows will be limited to maxRows and DEFAULT_MAX_TEXT_COL_WIDTH will be used to limit the width of text columns (like a VARCHAR column).
      Parameters:
      conn - Database connection object (java.sql.Connection)
      tableName - Name of the database table
      maxRows - Number of max. rows to query and print

    • printTable

      public static void printTable(Connection conn, String tableName, int maxRows, int maxStringColWidth)
      Overloaded method that prints rows from table tableName to standard out using the given database connection conn. Total number of rows will be limited to maxRows and maxStringColWidth will be used to limit the width of text columns (like a VARCHAR column).
      Parameters:
      conn - Database connection object (java.sql.Connection)
      tableName - Name of the database table
      maxRows - Number of max. rows to query and print
      maxStringColWidth - Max. width of text columns

    • printResultSet

      public static void printResultSet(ResultSet rs)
      Overloaded method to print rows of a ResultSet to standard out using DEFAULT_MAX_TEXT_COL_WIDTH to limit the width of text columns.
      Parameters:
      rs - The ResultSet to print

    • printResultSet

      public static void printResultSet(ResultSet rs, int maxStringColWidth)
      Overloaded method to print rows of a ResultSet to standard out using maxStringColWidth to limit the width of text columns.
      Parameters:
      rs - The ResultSet to print
      maxStringColWidth - Max. width of text columns
